meanings.definition: Not willing or inclined to listen or be open to new ideas or suggestions.
meanings.sent1: She was unreceptive to the idea of trying a new food.
meanings.sent2: The student was unreceptive to feedback on his essay.
meanings.sent3: The cat was unreceptive to wearing a costume for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed unreceptive to the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The closed door appeared unreceptive to any attempts to open it.

meanings.definition: Not responsive or accepting of something.
meanings.sent1: The baby was unreceptive to the new toy.
meanings.sent2: The customer was unreceptive to the sales pitch.
meanings.sent3: The computer was unreceptive to the outdated software.
meanings.sent4: The soil seemed unreceptive to the new plant.
meanings.sent5: The dark room felt unreceptive to any light entering.
